'''Rob Georg''' (born 24 September 1975) is a German country music singer.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.country.de/2018/07/16/rob-georg-der-singende-cowboy/|title=Rob Georg – der singende Cowboy {{!}} Country.de – Online Magazin|website=www.country.de|date=16 July 2018|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.backstagepro.de/rob-georg-music|title=Rob Georg Music, Songwriter (Rock, Alternative/Independent) aus Walldürn – Backstage PRO|website=backstagepro.de|language=de|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://comeherefloyd.com/2018/12/good-coffee-the-evening-empire-rob-georg-modern-violence-josh-hoyer-soul-colossal/|title=Good Coffee // The Evening Empire // Rob Georg // Modern Violence // Josh Hoyer & Soul Colossal|last=Staff|first=Chf|date=30 December 2018|website=comeherefloyd|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://thebandcampdiaries.com/post/182718755252/rob-georg-carry-the-wind-rob-georg-a-talented|title=thebandcampdiaries|website=thebandcampdiaries|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref> His records are regularly tracked in [[Nashville]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://blog.drooble.com/think-big-and-follow-your-dreams-interview-with-rob-georg/|title=Think big and follow your dreams – Interview with Rob Georg|date=11 January 2019|website=Drooble The Blog|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://stereostickman.com/reviews/rob-georg-carry-the-wind/|title=Rob Georg – Carry The Wind|website=Stereo Stickman|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ratingsgamemusic.com/2019/02/13/rob-georg-dedicates-a-song-to-all-the-horses-in-heaven-called-carry-the-wind-review-stream/|title=Rob Georg Dedicates A Song To All The Horses in Heaven Called 'Carry The Wind' (Review & Stream)|last1=B|first1=The Widows Peak|last2=it|date=13 February 2019|website=The Ratings Game|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url= https://nashvillevoyager.com/interview/rising-stars-meet-rob-georg-of-south-nashville-germany/|title=Meet Rob Georg – Nashville Voyager|date=31 January 2022|website=Nashville Voyager|access-date=26 June 2022}}</ref>

==Biography==
Georg was born in the city of [[Tübingen]] in Germany. As a child, he learned to play piano, as a teenager he switched to guitar and started to write his own songs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rautemusik.fm/musik/Rob-Georg/|title=Rob Georg|last=www.RauteMusik.FM|website=RauteMusik.FM|language=de-DE|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref> He bought his first guitar at the age of 14. Georg began his career with the song ‘Push That Horn’  which was released in June 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.country.de/2019/02/07/rob-georg-veroeffentlicht-weitere-single/|title=Rob Georg veröffentlicht weitere Single {{!}} Country.de – Online Magazin|website=www.country.de|date=7 February 2019|access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref> His first ever full band release from December 2018, the song "This Ain't My First Rodeo" made it into the US National Radio Hits AC Charts Top Ten.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nationalradiohits.com/charts/ac-40/|title=AC National Radio Hits|website=www.nationalradiohits.com|access-date=27 April 2019}}</ref> Also his following radio releases until today made it into the US National Radio Hits AC Charts, the song "Carry The Wind", which he wrote for his horse in heaven, was leading these charts for three weeks in October 2019, followed by "Dust" in being on position 1 in February 2020 and "Ghost in September 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nationalradiohits.com/charts/ac-40/|title=AC National Radio Hits|website=www.nationalradiohits.com|access-date=16 February 2020}}</ref>

In January 2020 his Debut Album "Radio Cowboy" was released with 15 songs on it. They all tell stories about his life on the ranch and things he has been through.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.rawckus.com/rob-georg-releases-marvelous-radio-cowboy/|title=Rob Georg releases marvelous radio cowboy|website=www.rawckus.com|date=30 January 2020|access-date=16 February 2020}}</ref> The nomination for two awards, the "New Music Award" in three categories in the US,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://newmusicawards.com/nma-ballot/|title=New Music Awards|website=newmusicawards.com|access-date=16 February 2020}}</ref> the Fair Play Country Music Red Carpet Awards in the Netherlands<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/fairplaycountrymusicawardshow/photos/a.130191655046668/181397026592797/?type=3&theater|title=FB Page Fair Play Country Music Magazine|website=facebook.com/fairplaycountrymusicawardshow/|access-date=16 February 2020}}</ref> and being announced the winner of the Country Artist of the Year 2020 Award by Warlock Asylum International News<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://warlockasyluminternationalnews.com/2020/01/30/2020-country-music-artist-of-the-year-rob-georg/|title=International News Site|website=warlockasyluminternationalnews.com|access-date=16 February 2020}}</ref> gave him a good start in early 2020. In March 2020 he won the New Music Award <ref>{{Cite web|url= https://newmusicawards.com/nma-winners/|title=New Music Awards|website=newmusicawards.com|access-date=1 April 2020}}</ref> in the category “Country Breakthrough Artist of the Year 2020“ in the US!

During the pandemic, both of Rob's parents were diagnosed with severe illnesses, so he decided to step in as a caretaker for his Mom and Dad. Utilizing the nights, he finally came up with new emotive country singles, which are published from March 2022 on, winning the next New Music Award in the category “Country Breakthrough Artist of the Year 2022“ in the United States!

Growing up with horses, Rob's professional path led him first into equine sports, especially into Cutting, a discipline of western riding, which is ridden on horses working cattle. From 2009 to 2018, he has successfully showed Cutting Horses in Europe and the US and was on the board of the National Cutting Horse Association of Germany for 6 years, most of this time as president.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rob-georg-music.com/bio/|title=Rob Georg Bio|website=www.rob-georg-music.com|access-date=26 June 2019}}</ref>

Influenced by the cowboy lifestyle, country music owns a big part of his musical passion. In various performances at family and friends events, Rob was always told, to do more with music in his life.
